element.summary: Runs a python job under the pyspark framework

template.form_info: Create a new template element

templateOptions.label: Template Name
templateOptions.placeholder: The template name

templateOptions.label: Form Info
templateOptions.placeholder: Text or HTML providing help for the user

templateOptions.label: Role/Key
templateOptions.placeholder: The role name of the template (used in parent and child filters)

templateOptions.label: Sub-Role/Keys
templateOptions.placeholder: Optional sub-keys used only in child filters

templateOptions.label: Categories
templateOptions.placeholder: Comma-separated list of categories (determines folder name)

templateOptions.label: Parent Filters
templateOptions.placeholder: Comma-separated list of filters determining for which parents this should be displayed

templateOptions.label: Child Filters
templateOptions.placeholder: Comma-separated list of filters determining which child elements should be displayed

post_building_function._fn:
function(errs, template, curr_obj, all_templates, root_obj, hierarchy, rows, cols) {
  
}

element.summary: Some sensible defaults

form_model.json:
{
    "analytic_type": "BATCH",
    "lock_to_nodes": true,
    "analytic_technology_name_or_id": "/app/aleph2/library/spark_technology.jar",
    "job_config": "{
}",
    "language": "python",
    "cluster_mode": "yarn-cluster",
    "include_job_config_in_spark_config": true,
	"script": "import sys
from pyspark import SparkContext
from pyspark import SparkConf
from aleph2_driver import Aleph2Driver

if __name__ == "__main__":
  sc = SparkContext(appName="JOB_NAME")
  aleph2 = Aleph2Driver(sc, sys.argv[1])
  #EXAMPLES:
  #names = aleph2.getRddInputNames()
  #rdd1 = aleph2.getAllRddInputs(sc)
  #rdd2 = aleph2.getRddInput(sc, "NAME")
  #count = aleph2.emitRdd(rdd1)
  #count = aleph2.externalEmitRdd(rdd1)
  "
}

template.form_info: Type raw JSON into here to create default values for the different schemas (referenced by key)
